intro: Hieracium hypochoerioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Hieracium hypochoerioides is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some regions.
